data.title: Martine McCutcheon questioned 'should I be doing this?' before starring in Love Actually
data.meta_description: Martine McCutcheon has shared how she feels about classic Christmas film Love Actually, 20 years after the film was made, in an exclusive chat with Express.co.uk.
data.text:
“I still pinch myself that I was part of such a stellar cast,” Martine exclaimed.

“The biggest names that there were, and I look back at it so fondly because none of them had anything to prove.

“I was still really young and felt like ‘Oh God should I be doing this?’ whereas they had all earned their stripes.

“They had won Oscars and had been in the biggest Hollywood movies going.”

The Love Actually cast includes some of Britain’s best homegrown talent, including Bill Nighy, Emma Thompson, Colin Firth, Liam Neeson, Keira Knightley and Hugh Grant, whom Martine had a particularly close relationship with due to the connection of their two characters.

Feeling slight imposter syndrome on set, Martine went on to say that her worries were quickly squashed.

“They really took me under their wing,” the former EastEnders actress said.

“They really wanted me to shine and whenever I think about making that movie or whenever people talk about it, it just makes me smile.”

It is not just the cast and the opportunity that it provided Martine within her career that she is grateful to, the actress went on to say that the message of the film remains relevant today, and perhaps always will.

“The message of different kinds of love and loss more than ever in these unstable times, is a timeless message.

“It never really stops hitting that spot that makes you go ‘Oh my God’.

“I feel really proud, not that I was just part of the film because of the cast, but because of its message. I think that is what I am most proud of.”
